page.title: 17AGRICULTURE
page.content: The agricultural land in the area is mainly grade 1 land (very fertile). It grows such things as potatoes, cabbages, barley and wheat. Much of the produce is sold locally. The building of the airport has affected the farmland because it has changed the level of the water table and made it less fertile. The area between Holloway Lane and the M 4 was once also grade 1 land. This area was then used as a refuge dump and later returned to farmland. However, it was not good enough to farm and is now used to graze horses. It collects large amounts of water and yet cannot be built upon for 15 years. Restrictions are now much stricter and the Greater London Council are determined to resist pressure to build on farmland
